question: When is this gross motor milestone attained by a child?
exp: The given picture shows a child creeping upstairs, that comes at around 15 months age; Another impoant milestone that appears at around 15 months age is Jargon speech

question: A baby can follow an object till 180o, can hold neck, can sit with suppo but cannot sit without suppo. The age of the baby is:
exp: Following an object up to 180deg comes at 2 months, Neck holding comes at 3 months, Sitting with suppo is attained at 6 months; So, the age of this baby is 6 months

question: When does a child attain this impoant fine motor milestone?
exp: The given picture shows 'mature pincer grasp' which develops at 12 month. 6 months Unidextrous or palmar grasp 7 months Transfer objects from 1 hand to another 9 months immature/ assisted pincer grasp 12 months mature/unassisted pincer grasp- 'CASTING'

question: Which of the following appears 1st in child?
exp: Age of appearance of the given milestones is: Mirror play: 6 months Pincer grasp: 9 months Crawling: 8 months Creeping: 10 months, So the 1st to appear out of these is mirror play

question: All of the following are true about development EXCEPT?
exp: Development progresses in a cephalocaudal direction; So head control preceds trunk control, which precedes limb control.
opb: Depends on functional maturation of nervous system
opc: Ceain primitive reflexes have to be lost before relevant milestones attained
opd: Limb control precedes trunk and head control

question: What is the sequence in which the following milestones are attained?
exp: A - Ties shoe laces -5 years B - Copies circle - 3 years C - Feeds self with spoon - 18 months D- Buttons & unbuttons - 4 years

question: When does the child attain the following milestone?
exp: The given picture shows 'pivoting' i. e. turning around to pick up an object, that comes at 11 months.

question: At what age the child begins to do the following?
exp: By 12 weeks, the child can lift his head above the horizontal plane in prone position.

question: A baby can hold neck, can sit with suppo but cannot sit without suppo. The age of the baby is:
exp: Neck holding comes at 3 months, Sitting with suppo is attained at 6 months; So, the age of this baby is 6 months

question: A child is able to draw a triangle by the age of:-
exp: A child is able to draw a triangle by the age of:-5 years

question: Which of the following cannot be done by a 15 month child?
exp: A child speaks 2 word sentences at 2 years and 3 word sentences at 3 years -walks with suppo 12 months onwards, -transfers objects at 7 months, -builds a tower of 2 cubes at 15 months
opb: Transfers objects from 1 hand to another

question: The above milestone comes at approximately:-
exp: The given picture shows sitting with suppo at 6 months. (Tripod position) Sitting without suppo comes at 8 month ross Motor Visual Motor Language Social adaptive 4 mo SSHolds head steadily* SS Suppos on forearms in prone SSRollsfromprone to supine* SS Reaches with both arms together SS Hands to midline SSBidextrous grasp (4-5 mo) SS Laugh aloud SS Likes to look around 6 mo SS Sits with suppo (tripod) SSFeet in mouthin supine SSUnilateral reach* SSTransfers object* SS Babbles SSMonosyllables* SS Recognizes stranger SSMirror play* 7 mo SSRollsfromsupine to prone* SSPivoting in Prone* SS Maycrawl* SSSitting without suppo* SSUnidextrous /Palmargrasp* SSStranger anxiety*

question: Which of the following milestones is not developed at 1 year?
exp: A child is able to copy a circle at 3 years age

question: Arrange the following developmental milestones in order of appearance (age wise) (first to last) a. Immature pincer grasp b. Rolls over c. Laugh loud d. 1-2 words with meaning
exp: Option c - laugh out loud - 4 months Option b - rolls over - 5 months Option a - immature pincer grasp - 9 months Option d - 1-2 words with meaning - 12 month Table:- key groups motor development milestones Age Milestone 3 months Neck holding 5 months Rolls over 6 months Sits in tripod fashion (sitting with own suppo) 8 months Sitting without suppo 9 months Stands holding on (with suppo) 12 months Creeps well; walks but falls; stands without suppo 15 months Walks alone; creeps upstairs 18 months Runs; explores drawers 2 year Walks up and downstairs (2 feet/step); jumps 3 years Rides tricyclic; alternate feet going upstairs 4 years Hops on one foot; alternate feet going downstairs Table:- Key fine motor milestones Age Milestone 4 months Bidextrous reach (reaching out for objects with both hands) 6 months Unidextrous reach (reaching out for objects with one hand); transfers objects 9 months Immature pincer grasp; p[robes with forefinger 12 months Pincer grasp mature 15 months Imitates scribbling; tower of 2 blocks 18 months Scribbles; tower of 3 blocks 2 years Tower of 6 blocks; veical and circular stroke 3 years Tower of 9 blocks; copies circle 4 years Copies cross; bridge with blocks 5 years Copies triangle: gate with blocks Table: Key social and adaptive milestones Age Milestones 2 months Social smile (smile after being talked to) 3 months Recognizes mother; anticipates feeds 6 months Recognizes strangers, stranger anxiety 9 months Waves "bye bye" 12 months Comes when called; plays simple ball game 15 months Jargon 18 months Copies parents in task (e. g. sweeping) 2 years Asks for food, drink, toilet; pulls people to show toys 3 years Shares toys; knows full name and gender 4 years Plays cooperatively in a group; goes to toilet alone 5 years Helps in household tasks, dresses and undresses Table: key language milestones Age Milestone 1 month Ales to sound 3 months Coos(musical vowel sounds) 4 months Laugh loud 6 months Monosyllables (ba, da, pa), ah-goo sounds 9 months Bisyllables (mama, baba, dada) 12 months 1-2 words with meaning 18 months 8-10 word vocabulary 2 years 2-3 word sentence, uses pronouns "I", "me", "you" 3 years Asks questions; knows full name and gender 4 years Says song or poem; tells stories 5 years Asks meaning of words

question: A child can make a bridge with blocks at:-
exp: 4 years - Bridge with blocks 5 years - Gate with blocks

question: When can a child begin to take a biscuit to his mouth?
exp: By 6 months, a child can begin to take a biscuit to his mouth. By 12 months, he can try to feed self with a cup but spills some of contents. By 15 months, he can drink from cup without much spilling By 18 months, he can feed himself well with a spoon

question: A child can make a tower of 6 cubes at the age of?
exp: A child can make a tower of 6 cubes at 2 years. -tower of 2 cubes at 15 months, 3 cube tower at the age of 18 months
